text:
The divisions of the gatekeepers:

From the Korahites: Meshelemiah, son of Kore, one of the sons of Asaph.

Meshelemiah’s sons:

The firstborn Zechariah, the second Jediael, the third Zebadiah, the fourth Jathniel,
the fifth Elam, the sixth Jehohanan, and the seventh Elihoenai.

Obed-Edom’s sons:

The firstborn Shemaiah, the second Jehozabad, the third Joah, the fourth Sakar, the fifth Nethanel,
the sixth Ammiel, the seventh Issachar, and the eighth Peullethai. (Indeed, God blessed Obed-Edom.)
His son Shemaiah also had sons, who were leaders of their families, for they were highly respected.

The sons of Shemaiah:

Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad. His relatives Elihu and Semakiah were also respected.
All these were the descendants of Obed-Edom. They and their sons and relatives were respected men, capable of doing their responsibilities. There were sixty-two of them related to Obed-Edom.
Meshelemiah had sons and relatives who were respected—eighteen in all.

Hosah, one of the descendants of Merari, had sons:

The firstborn Shimri (he was not actually the firstborn, but his father gave him that status),
the second Hilkiah, the third Tebaliah, and the fourth Zechariah. All Hosah’s sons and relatives numbered thirteen.
These divisions of the gatekeepers, corresponding to their leaders, had assigned responsibilities, like their relatives, as they served in the Lord’s temple.
They cast lots, both young and old, according to their families, to determine which gate they would be responsible for.

The <st data-num="01486" class="">lot</st> for the <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st> gate <st data-num="05307" class="">went</st> to <st data-num="08018" class="">Shelemiah</st>.<n id="1" /> They then <st data-num="05307" class="">cast</st> <st data-num="01486" class="">lots</st> for his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="02148" class="">Zechariah</st>, a <st data-num="07922" class="">wise</st> <st data-num="03289" class="">adviser</st>, and the <st data-num="01486" class="">lot</st> for the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st> gate <st data-num="03318" class="">went</st> to him.

<st data-num="05654" class="">Obed-Edom</st> was assigned the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st> gate, and his <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> were assigned the <st data-num="01004 0624">storehouses</st>.

<st data-num="08206" class="">Shuppim</st> and <st data-num="02621" class="">Hosah</st> were assigned the <st data-num="04628" class="">west</st> gate, <st data-num="05973" class="">along with</st> the <st data-num="07996" class="">Shalleketh</st> <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st> on the <st data-num="05927" class="">upper</st> <st data-num="04546" class="">road</st>. One <st data-num="04929" class="">guard</st> was <st data-num="05980" class="">adjacent to</st> <st data-num="04929" class="">another</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03117" class="">Each</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> there were <st data-num="08337" class="">six</st> <st data-num="03881" class="">Levites</st> posted on the <st data-num="04217" class="">east</st>, <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> on the <st data-num="06828" class="">north</st>, and <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> on the <st data-num="05045" class="">south</st>. At the <st data-num="0624" class="">storehouses</st> they were posted <st data-num="08147" class="">in</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">pairs</st>.

At the <st data-num="06503" class="">court</st> on the <st data-num="04628" class="">west</st> there were <st data-num="0702" class="">four</st> posted on the <st data-num="04546" class="">road</st> and <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> at the <st data-num="06503" class="">court</st>.
These were the divisions of the gatekeepers who were descendants of Korah and Merari.
Their fellow Levites were in charge of the storehouses in God’s temple and the storehouses containing consecrated items.

The <st data-num="01121" class="">descendants</st> of <st data-num="03936" class="">Ladan</st>,<n id="1" /> who were <st data-num="01121" class="">descended</st> from <st data-num="01649" class="">Gershon</st> through <st data-num="03936" class="">Ladan</st> and were <st data-num="07218" class="">leaders</st> of the <st data-num="01" class="">families</st> of <st data-num="03936" class="">Ladan</st> the <st data-num="01649" class="">Gershonite</st>, included <st data-num="03172" class="">Jehieli</st><n id="2" />
and the sons of Jehieli, Zetham and his brother Joel. They were in charge of the storehouses in the Lord’s temple.
As for the Amramites, Izharites, Hebronites, and Uzzielites:
Shebuel son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was the supervisor of the storehouses.

His <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st> through <st data-num="0461" class="">Eliezer</st> included: <st data-num="07345" class="">Rehabiah</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, <st data-num="03470" class="">Jeshaiah</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, <st data-num="03141" class="">Joram</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, <st data-num="02147" class="">Zikri</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, and <st data-num="08019">Shelomith</st><n id="1" /> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>.

<st data-num="01931 08019">Shelomith</st><n id="1" /> and his <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st> were <st data-num="05921" class="">in charge of</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="0214" class="">storehouses</st> containing the <st data-num="06944 0834">consecrated items</st> <st data-num="06942" class="">dedicated</st> by <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, the <st data-num="01" class="">family</st> <st data-num="07218" class="">leaders</st> who <st data-num="08269" class="">led</st> <st data-num="0505 03967">units</st> of a <st data-num="0505" class="">thousand</st> and a <st data-num="03967" class="">hundred</st>, and the <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st> <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st>.
They had dedicated some of the plunder taken in battles to be used for repairs on the Lord’s temple.

They were also in charge of everything dedicated by Samuel the prophet, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah; Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of everything that had been dedicated.
As for the Izharites: Kenaniah and his sons were given responsibilities outside the temple as officers and judges over Israel.
As for the Hebronites: Hashabiah and his relatives, 1,700 respected men, were assigned responsibilities in Israel west of the Jordan; they did the Lord’s work and the king’s service.

As for the Hebronites: Jeriah was the leader of the Hebronites according to the genealogical records. In the fortieth year of David’s reign, they examined the records and discovered there were highly respected men in Jazer in Gilead.

Jeriah had 2,700 relatives who were respected family leaders. King David placed them in charge of the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh; they took care of all matters pertaining to God and the king.
